|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="event-resource_policylevel">policyLevel<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#event-resource_policylevel" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The [policy level](../../spec-extensions/access-strategies/) (aka. compliance level) that this ORD Document or part of it needs to be compliant with.<br/>Depending on the chosen policy level, certain expectations and validations rules will be applied.<br/><br/>The policy level can be defined on ORD Document level, but also be overwritten on an individual package or resource level.<br/><br/>If not provided, no additional policy level expectations and validations apply.<br/><br/><hr/><strong>Allowed Values</strong>: <ul><li><p>`"none"`: No policy level chosen. Only the base rules on how to create correct ORD documents apply.<br/><br/>This corresponds to the SAP `sap:base:v1` compliance level.</p></li><li><p>`"sap:core:v1"`: SAP core rules and guidelines apply.<br/><br/>If chosen the [SAP Core V1](../../spec-extensions/policy-levels/sap-core-v1) rules MUST be followed.</p></li><li><p>`"custom"`: Custom policy level.<br/><br/>Further validation MAY be defined and implemented by the policy-level owner.<br/>This level MAY be chosen by 3rd party or customer solutions.<br/><br/>If chosen, `customPolicyLevel` MUST be provided.</p></li></ul><br/><strong class="introduced-version">Introduced in Version</strong>: 1.3.0<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap:core:v1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="event-resource_custompolicylevel">customPolicyLevel<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#event-resource_custompolicylevel" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">If the fixed `policyLevel` values need to be extended, an arbitrary `customPolicyLevel` can be provided.<br/><br/>The policy level is inherited from packages to resources they contain, but can be overwritten at resource level.<br/><br/>MUST only be provided if `policyLevel` is set to `custom`.<br/><br/>MUST be a valid [Specification ID](../index.md#specification-id).<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):v(\[0-9\]+)$</code><br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap.xref:customPolicy:v1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="event-resource_systeminstanceaware">systemInstanceAware<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#event-resource_systeminstanceaware" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">boolean</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Defines whether this ORD resource is **system instance aware**.<br/>This is the case (and relevant) when the referenced resource definitions are potentially different between **system instances**.<br/><br/>If this behavior applies, `systemInstanceAware` MUST be set to true.<br/>An ORD aggregator that represents a system instance aware perspective MUST fetch the referenced resource definitions,<br/>not just once per system type, but once per **system instance**.<br/><hr/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`true`</li></ul></div>|

### Entity Type

An entity type ideally describes an underlying conceptual model that is then exposed through one or multiple API and events resources.
It is a well-defined named abstract concept in SAP software representing a data model and behavioral model of a concrete business or technical entity.

The most known example for entity types are the [SAP Object Types (SOTs)](https://ui.gtnc.sap.corp/webapp/index.html#/SAPObjectTypes//OneColumn//TilePress) of VDM and the [ODM Entities](https://ui.gtnc.sap.corp/webapp/index.html#/ODMEntities//OneColumn//TilePress).

| Property | Type | Description |
| -------- | ---- | ----------- |
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_ordid">ordId<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_ordid" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The ORD ID is a stable, globally unique ID for ORD resources or taxonomy.<br/><br/>It MUST be a valid [ORD ID](../index.md#ord-id) of the appropriate ORD type.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(entityType):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):(v0\|v\[1-9\]\[0-9\]\*)$</code><br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap.odm:entityType:BusinessPartner:v1"`</li><li>`"sap.odm:entityType:CostCenter:v1"`</li><li>`"sap.odm:entityType:WorkforcePerson:v1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_localid">localId<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_localid" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Local ID, as known by the described system.<br/><hr/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong class="introduced-version">Introduced in Version</strong>: 1.2.1<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"BusinessPartner"`</li><li>`"CostCenter"`</li><li>`"WorkforcePerson"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_correlationids">correlationIds<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_correlationids" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Correlation IDs can be used to create a reference to related data in other repositories (especially to the system of record).<br/><br/>MUST be a valid [Correlation ID](../index.md#correlation-id).<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\\/\]+):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\\/\]+)$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["sap.s4:sot:BusinessPartner"]`</li><li>`["sap.s4:sot:CostCenter"]`</li><li>`["sap.s4:sot:WorkforcePerson"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_title">title<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_title" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Human-readable title.<br/><br/>MUST NOT exceed 255 chars.<br/>MUST NOT contain line breaks.<br/><hr/><strong>Minimum Length</strong>: `1`<br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"Business Partner"`</li><li>`"Cost Center"`</li><li>`"Workforce Person"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_shortdescription">shortDescription<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_shortdescription" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Plain text short description.<br/><br/>MUST NOT exceed 255 chars.<br/>MUST NOT contain line breaks.<br/><hr/><strong>Minimum Length</strong>: `1`<br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"A business partner is a person, an organization, or a group of persons or organizations in which a company has a business interest."`</li><li>`"A cost center is an organizational center where costs are incurred and for which costs are recorded separately."`</li><li>`"A workforce person is a natural person with a work agreement or relationship in form of a work assignment; it can be an employee or a contingent worker."`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_description">description<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_description" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Full description, notated in [CommonMark](https://spec.commonmark.org/) (Markdown).<br/><hr/><strong>Minimum Length</strong>: `1`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"A business partner is a person, an organization, or a group of persons or organizations in which a company has a business interest.\n"`</li><li>`"A cost center is an organizational center where costs are incurred and for which costs are recorded separately.\n"`</li><li>`"A workforce person is a natural person with a work agreement or relationship in form of a work assignment; it can be an employee or a contingent worker.\n"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_partofpackage">partOfPackage<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_partofpackage" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Defines which Package the resource is part of.<br/><br/>MUST be a valid reference to a [Package](#package) ORD ID.<br/><br/>Every resource MUST be part of one package.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(package):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):(v0\|v\[1-9\]\[0-9\]\*)$</code><br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap.xref:package:SomePackage:v1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_partofproducts">partOfProducts<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_partofproducts" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">List of products this resource is a part of.<br/><br/>MUST be a valid reference to a [Product](#product) ORD ID.<br/><br/>`partOfProducts` that are assigned to a `Package` are inherited to all of the ORD resources it contains.<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(product):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):()$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["sap:product:S4HANA_OD:"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_version">version<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_version" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The complete [SemVer](https://semver.org/) version string.<br/><br/>It MUST follow the [Semantic Versioning 2.0.0](https://semver.org/) standard.<br/>It SHOULD be changed if the ORD information or referenced resource definitions changed.<br/>It SHOULD express minor and patch changes that don't lead to incompatible changes.<br/><br/>When the `version` major version changes, the [ORD ID](#ord-id) `<majorVersion>` fragment MUST be updated to be identical.<br/>In case that a resource definition file also contains a version number (e.g. [OpenAPI `info`.`version`](https://swagger.io/specification/#info-object)), it MUST be equal with the resource `version` to avoid inconsistencies.<br/><br/>The general [Version and Lifecycle](../index.md#version-and-lifecycle) flow MUST be followed.<br/><br/>Note: A change is only relevant for a version increment, if it affects the ORD resource or ORD taxonomy directly.<br/>For example: If a resource within a `Package` changes, but the package itself did not, the package version does not need to be incremented.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(0\|\[1-9\]\d\*)\\.(0\|\[1-9\]\d\*)\\.(0\|\[1-9\]\d\*)(?:-((?:0\|\[1-9\]\d\*\|\d\*\[a-zA-Z-\]\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]\*)(?:\\.(?:0\|\[1-9\]\d\*\|\d\*\[a-zA-Z-\]\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]\*))\*))?(?:\\+(\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]+(?:\\.\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]+)\*))?$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"1.2.3"`</li><li>`"1.0.0-alpha.1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_lastupdate">lastUpdate<br/><span class="recommended">RECOMMENDED</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_lastupdate" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Optional, but RECOMMENDED indicator when (date-time) the last change to the resource (including its definitions) happened.<br/><br/>The date format MUST comply with [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).<br/><br/>In case that this property is available and the value of it hasn't changed since the last crawling, the resource definitions do not need to be fetched and updated.<br/><br/>Together with `systemInstanceAware`, this property SHOULD be used to optimize the metadata crawling process of the ORD aggregators.<br/><hr/><strong>JSON Schema Format</strong>: `date-time`<br/><strong class="introduced-version">Introduced in Version</strong>: 1.4.0<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"2022-12-19T15:47:04+00:00"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_visibility">visibility<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_visibility" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The visibility/exposure of the described resource.<br/>This indicates who is allowed to see (and implicitly also access) the described resource.<br/><hr/><strong>Allowed Values</strong>: <ul><li><p>`"public"`: Resources are publicly accessible to customers and 3rd parties.<br/>Usually this includes an contract on the API stability, e.g. the [SAP API Deprecation Policy](https://help.sap.com/viewer/84b35b9c39b247e3ba2a31f02beee46d/Cloud/en-US/5cbfda5a9efe4e97a3e24ddaf7ec5c16.html).</p></li><li><p>`"internal"`: Resources are accessible to other applications within the same organization.<br/>However, they are not officially exposed and communicated to customers and 3rd parties.<br/>They might not come with the same guarantees on API stability.<br/><br/>Internal resources MUST NOT be made available to consumers without checking the necessary access permissions, e.g., a public API Catalog.<br/>Internal resources MAY be published through an internal API Catalog if the access permissions are ensured by it.</p></li><li><p>`"private"`: Resources that are exclusively used within an application or service.<br/>This includes resources that may be called from outside but serve purely private purposes and are not supposed to be known by other outside parties.<br/>E.g., webhooks for provisioning callbacks or backing services.<br/><br/>Private resources MUST NOT be made available to public consumers or consumers outside of the "private" scope or without the necessary access permissions.</p></li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_releasestatus">releaseStatus<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_releasestatus" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The `releaseStatus` specifies the stability of the resource and its external contract.<br/><hr/><strong>Allowed Values</strong>: <ul><li><p>`"active"`: Resource is meant for productive use and provides a stable API contract.</p></li><li><p>`"beta"`: The contract for the resource is beta and MAY not be meant for productive use.<br/><br/>In the SAP context, `beta` APIs may be changed or deleted at SAPs discretion.</p></li><li><p>`"deprecated"`: Resource has been deprecated and is destined to be decommissioned (removed) in the future.<br/><br/>Once the resource is decommissioned:<br/> * It MUST be removed from ORD.<br/> * Its removal MUST be explicitly indicated through a `Tombstone`.<br/> * If successor resources exists, they MUST be referenced through `successors`.<br/><br/>In cases where an `active` version of the API exists, it is advisable to migrate to the `active` version,<br/>however, an `active` version may not exist in all cases.</p></li></ul><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"active"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_deprecationdate">deprecationDate<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_deprecationdate" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The deprecation date defines when the resource has been set as deprecated.<br/>This is not to be confused with the `sunsetDate` which defines when the resource will be actually decommissioned / removed.<br/><br/>If the `releaseStatus` is set to `deprecated`, the `deprecationDate` SHOULD be provided.<br/><br/>The date format MUST comply with [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).<br/><hr/><strong>JSON Schema Format</strong>: `date-time`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"2020-12-08T15:47:04+00:00"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_sunsetdate">sunsetDate<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_sunsetdate" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The sunset date defines when the resource is scheduled to be decommissioned/removed.<br/><br/>If the `releaseStatus` is set to `deprecated`, the `sunsetDate` MUST be provided.<br/><br/>The date format MUST comply with [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).<br/><hr/><strong>JSON Schema Format</strong>: `date-time`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"2022-01-08T15:47:04+00:00"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_successors">successors<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_successors" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The successor resource(s).<br/><br/>MUST be a valid reference to an [API Resource](#api-resource) ORD ID.<br/><br/>If the `releaseStatus` is set to `deprecated`, `successors` MUST be provided if one exists.<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(entityType):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):(v0\|v\[1-9\]\[0-9\]\*)$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["sap.odm:entityType:BusinessPartner:v2"]`</li><li>`["sap.odm:entityType:CostCenter:v2"]`</li><li>`["sap.odm:entityType:WorkforcePerson:v2"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_changelogentries">changelogEntries<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_changelogentries" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;[Changelog Entry](#changelog-entry)&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Contains changelog entries that summarize changes with special regards to version and releaseStatus<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_level">level<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_level" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Defining the abstraction level of the entity type using the DDD terminology.<br/><br/>In Domain-Driven Design, there is a concept of entities and aggregates. There are root entities which may contain<br/>further sub entities by composition. The complete “package” is then called an aggregate, which gets its name and identity<br/>from the root entity.  An aggregate is a cluster of domain objects that can be treated as a single unit.  The root<br/>is the entity that is referenced from outside the aggregate. There must be only one root per aggregate. The root<br/>ensures the integrity of the aggregate. A sub entity is any other non-root entity in the aggregate. Source, see<br/>[Martin Fowler on DDD Aggregate](https://martinfowler.com/bliki/DDD_Aggregate.html)<br/><br/>For now, we decided to only cover the aggregate level, which is described in the enum value.<br/><hr/><strong>Allowed Values</strong>: <ul><li><p>`"aggregate"`: An aggregate is a tree of entity types. The root entity gives the aggregate its identity and ID.<br/>But every entity that is part of the tree due to a composition relationship is also part of the aggregate.<br/>The inner structure of an aggregate (sub entities, field, etc.) can be described in the entity type definition.</p></li></ul><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"aggregate"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_links">links<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_links" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;[Link](#link)&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Generic Links with arbitrary meaning and content.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_extensible">extensible<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_extensible" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">[Extensible](#extensible)</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Describes extensibility of this resource.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_tags">tags<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_tags" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">List of free text style tags.<br/>No special characters are allowed except `-`, `_`, `.`, `/` and ` `.<br/><br/>Tags that are assigned to a `Package` are inherited to all of the ORD resources it contains.<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^\[a-zA-Z0-9-\_.\\/ \]\*$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["storage","high-availability"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_labels">labels<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_labels" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">[Labels](#labels)</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Generic labels that can be applied to most ORD information.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_documentationlabels">documentationLabels<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_documentationlabels" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">[Documentation Labels](#documentation-labels)</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Generic documentation labels that can be applied to most ORD information.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_policylevel">policyLevel<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_policylevel" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The [policy level](../../spec-extensions/access-strategies/) (aka. compliance level) that this ORD Document or part of it needs to be compliant with.<br/>Depending on the chosen policy level, certain expectations and validations rules will be applied.<br/><br/>The policy level can be defined on ORD Document level, but also be overwritten on an individual package or resource level.<br/><br/>If not provided, no additional policy level expectations and validations apply.<br/><br/><hr/><strong>Allowed Values</strong>: <ul><li><p>`"none"`: No policy level chosen. Only the base rules on how to create correct ORD documents apply.<br/><br/>This corresponds to the SAP `sap:base:v1` compliance level.</p></li><li><p>`"sap:core:v1"`: SAP core rules and guidelines apply.<br/><br/>If chosen the [SAP Core V1](../../spec-extensions/policy-levels/sap-core-v1) rules MUST be followed.</p></li><li><p>`"custom"`: Custom policy level.<br/><br/>Further validation MAY be defined and implemented by the policy-level owner.<br/>This level MAY be chosen by 3rd party or customer solutions.<br/><br/>If chosen, `customPolicyLevel` MUST be provided.</p></li></ul><br/><strong class="introduced-version">Introduced in Version</strong>: 1.3.0<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap:core:v1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_custompolicylevel">customPolicyLevel<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_custompolicylevel" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">If the fixed `policyLevel` values need to be extended, an arbitrary `customPolicyLevel` can be provided.<br/><br/>The policy level is inherited from packages to resources they contain, but can be overwritten at resource level.<br/><br/>MUST only be provided if `policyLevel` is set to `custom`.<br/><br/>MUST be a valid [Specification ID](../index.md#specification-id).<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):v(\[0-9\]+)$</code><br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap.xref:customPolicy:v1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="entity-type_systeminstanceaware">systemInstanceAware<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#entity-type_systeminstanceaware" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">boolean</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Defines whether this ORD resource is **system instance aware**.<br/>This is the case (and relevant) when the referenced resource definitions are potentially different between **system instances**.<br/><br/>If this behavior applies, `systemInstanceAware` MUST be set to true.<br/>An ORD aggregator that represents a system instance aware perspective MUST fetch the referenced resource definitions,<br/>not just once per system type, but once per **system instance**.<br/><hr/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`true`</li></ul></div>|

### Capability

Capabilities can be used to describe use case specific capabilities, most notably supported features or additional information (like configuration) that needs to be understood from outside.
This is a generic ORD concept that aims to cover many different capability discovery use cases that would otherwise need be implemented as individual service provider interfaces (SPIs).

If a capability needs to expose more information than possible with generic capability properties, a custom capability definition can be defined and referenced in ORD.
This is the same idea and mechanism as with API resources and their resource definition formats.

| Property | Type | Description |
| -------- | ---- | ----------- |
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_ordid">ordId<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_ordid" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The ORD ID is a stable, globally unique ID for ORD resources or taxonomy.<br/><br/>It MUST be a valid [ORD ID](../index.md#ord-id) of the appropriate ORD type.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9-\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9-\]+)\*):(capability):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):(alpha\|beta\|v\[0-9\]+\|)$</code><br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap.foo.bar:capability:fieldExtensibility:v1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_localid">localId<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_localid" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Local ID, as known by the described system.<br/><hr/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong class="introduced-version">Introduced in Version</strong>: 1.2.1<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"bundleXYZ"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_correlationids">correlationIds<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_correlationids" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Correlation IDs can be used to create a reference to related data in other repositories (especially to the system of record).<br/><br/>MUST be a valid [Correlation ID](../index.md#correlation-id).<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\\/\]+):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\\/\]+)$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["sap.s4:communicationScenario:SAP_COM_0008"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_type">type<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_type" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Type of the Capability<br/><hr/><strong>Allowed Values</strong>: <ul><li><p>`"custom"`: If chosen, `customType` MUST be provided.</p></li><li><p>`"sap.mdo:mdi-capability:v1"`: Capability for SAP Master Data Integration (MDI).<br/><br/>For the capability definitions: `type` MUST ONLY be set to `sap.mdo:mdi-capability-definition:v1`.</p></li></ul><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"custom"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_customtype">customType<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_customtype" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">If the fixed `type` enum values need to be extended, an arbitrary `customType` can be provided.<br/><br/>MUST be a valid [Specification ID](../index.md#specification-id).<br/><br/>MUST only be provided if `type` is set to `custom`.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):v(\[0-9\]+)$</code><br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap:custom-definition-format:v1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_title">title<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_title" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Human-readable title.<br/><br/>MUST NOT exceed 255 chars.<br/>MUST NOT contain line breaks.<br/><hr/><strong>Minimum Length</strong>: `1`<br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"MDI Capability"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_shortdescription">shortDescription<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_shortdescription" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Plain text short description.<br/><br/>MUST NOT exceed 255 chars.<br/>MUST NOT contain line breaks.<br/><hr/><strong>Minimum Length</strong>: `1`<br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"SAP S/4HANA Cloud, our next generation cloud ERP suite designed for in-memory computing."`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_description">description<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_description" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Full description, notated in [CommonMark](https://spec.commonmark.org/) (Markdown).<br/><hr/><strong>Minimum Length</strong>: `1`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"SAP S/4HANA Cloud, our next generation cloud ERP suite designed for\nin-memory computing, acts as a digital core, connecting your\nenterprise with people, business networks, the Internet of Things,\nBig Data, and more.\n"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_partofpackage">partOfPackage<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_partofpackage" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Defines which Package the resource is part of.<br/><br/>MUST be a valid reference to a [Package](#package) ORD ID.<br/><br/>Every resource MUST be part of one package.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(package):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):(v0\|v\[1-9\]\[0-9\]\*)$</code><br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap.xref:package:SomePackage:v1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_version">version<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_version" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The complete [SemVer](https://semver.org/) version string.<br/><br/>It MUST follow the [Semantic Versioning 2.0.0](https://semver.org/) standard.<br/>It SHOULD be changed if the ORD information or referenced resource definitions changed.<br/>It SHOULD express minor and patch changes that don't lead to incompatible changes.<br/><br/>When the `version` major version changes, the [ORD ID](#ord-id) `<majorVersion>` fragment MUST be updated to be identical.<br/>In case that a resource definition file also contains a version number (e.g. [OpenAPI `info`.`version`](https://swagger.io/specification/#info-object)), it MUST be equal with the resource `version` to avoid inconsistencies.<br/><br/>The general [Version and Lifecycle](../index.md#version-and-lifecycle) flow MUST be followed.<br/><br/>Note: A change is only relevant for a version increment, if it affects the ORD resource or ORD taxonomy directly.<br/>For example: If a resource within a `Package` changes, but the package itself did not, the package version does not need to be incremented.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(0\|\[1-9\]\d\*)\\.(0\|\[1-9\]\d\*)\\.(0\|\[1-9\]\d\*)(?:-((?:0\|\[1-9\]\d\*\|\d\*\[a-zA-Z-\]\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]\*)(?:\\.(?:0\|\[1-9\]\d\*\|\d\*\[a-zA-Z-\]\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]\*))\*))?(?:\\+(\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]+(?:\\.\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]+)\*))?$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"1.2.3"`</li><li>`"1.0.0-alpha.1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_lastupdate">lastUpdate<br/><span class="recommended">RECOMMENDED</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_lastupdate" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Optional, but RECOMMENDED indicator when (date-time) the last change to the resource (including its definitions) happened.<br/><br/>The date format MUST comply with [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).<br/><br/>In case that this property is available and the value of it hasn't changed since the last crawling, the resource definitions do not need to be fetched and updated.<br/><br/>Together with `systemInstanceAware`, this property SHOULD be used to optimize the metadata crawling process of the ORD aggregators.<br/><hr/><strong>JSON Schema Format</strong>: `date-time`<br/><strong class="introduced-version">Introduced in Version</strong>: 1.4.0<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"2022-12-19T15:47:04+00:00"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_visibility">visibility<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_visibility" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The visibility/exposure of the described resource.<br/>This indicates who is allowed to see (and implicitly also access) the described resource.<br/><hr/><strong>Allowed Values</strong>: <ul><li><p>`"public"`: Resources are publicly accessible to customers and 3rd parties.<br/>Usually this includes an contract on the API stability, e.g. the [SAP API Deprecation Policy](https://help.sap.com/viewer/84b35b9c39b247e3ba2a31f02beee46d/Cloud/en-US/5cbfda5a9efe4e97a3e24ddaf7ec5c16.html).</p></li><li><p>`"internal"`: Resources are accessible to other applications within the same organization.<br/>However, they are not officially exposed and communicated to customers and 3rd parties.<br/>They might not come with the same guarantees on API stability.<br/><br/>Internal resources MUST NOT be made available to consumers without checking the necessary access permissions, e.g., a public API Catalog.<br/>Internal resources MAY be published through an internal API Catalog if the access permissions are ensured by it.</p></li><li><p>`"private"`: Resources that are exclusively used within an application or service.<br/>This includes resources that may be called from outside but serve purely private purposes and are not supposed to be known by other outside parties.<br/>E.g., webhooks for provisioning callbacks or backing services.<br/><br/>Private resources MUST NOT be made available to public consumers or consumers outside of the "private" scope or without the necessary access permissions.</p></li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_releasestatus">releaseStatus<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_releasestatus" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The `releaseStatus` specifies the stability of the resource and its external contract.<br/><hr/><strong>Allowed Values</strong>: <ul><li><p>`"active"`: Resource is meant for productive use and provides a stable API contract.</p></li><li><p>`"beta"`: The contract for the resource is beta and MAY not be meant for productive use.<br/><br/>In the SAP context, `beta` APIs may be changed or deleted at SAPs discretion.</p></li><li><p>`"deprecated"`: Resource has been deprecated and is destined to be decommissioned (removed) in the future.<br/><br/>Once the resource is decommissioned:<br/> * It MUST be removed from ORD.<br/> * Its removal MUST be explicitly indicated through a `Tombstone`.<br/> * If successor resources exists, they MUST be referenced through `successors`.<br/><br/>In cases where an `active` version of the API exists, it is advisable to migrate to the `active` version,<br/>however, an `active` version may not exist in all cases.</p></li></ul><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"active"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_relatedentitytypes">relatedEntityTypes<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_relatedentitytypes" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Optional list of related EntityType Resources.<br/><br/>MUST be a valid reference to an [EntityType Resource](#entity-type) ORD ID.<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(entityType):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):(v0\|v\[1-9\]\[0-9\]\*)$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["sap.odm:entityType:WorkforcePerson:v1"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_definitions">definitions<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_definitions" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;[Capability Definition](#capability-definition)&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">List of available machine-readable capability definitions.<br/><br/>If capability definitions are added or changed, the `version` SHOULD be incremented and `lastUpdate` be updated.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_links">links<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_links" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;[Link](#link)&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Generic Links with arbitrary meaning and content.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_tags">tags<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_tags" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">List of free text style tags.<br/>No special characters are allowed except `-`, `_`, `.`, `/` and ` `.<br/><br/>Tags that are assigned to a `Package` are inherited to all of the ORD resources it contains.<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^\[a-zA-Z0-9-\_.\\/ \]\*$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["storage","high-availability"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_labels">labels<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_labels" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">[Labels](#labels)</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Generic labels that can be applied to most ORD information.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_documentationlabels">documentationLabels<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_documentationlabels" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">[Documentation Labels](#documentation-labels)</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Generic documentation labels that can be applied to most ORD information.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="capability_systeminstanceaware">systemInstanceAware<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#capability_systeminstanceaware" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">boolean</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Defines whether this ORD resource is **system instance aware**.<br/>This is the case (and relevant) when the referenced resource definitions are potentially different between **system instances**.<br/><br/>If this behavior applies, `systemInstanceAware` MUST be set to true.<br/>An ORD aggregator that represents a system instance aware perspective MUST fetch the referenced resource definitions,<br/>not just once per system type, but once per **system instance**.<br/><hr/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`true`</li></ul></div>|

### Integration Dependency

An [Integration Dependency](../../details/articles/integration-dependency) states that the described system (self) can integrate with external systems (integration target) to achieve an integration purpose.
The purpose could be to enable a certain feature or integration scenario, but it could also be a mandatory prerequisite for the described system to work.

The integration dependency includes a list of individual **aspects** that the integration consists of.
Each aspect can express alternatives (OR condition) on what  API and event resources can be used to achieve the same outcome.

The direction of connection establishment, data flow is not directly implied and needs to be inferred from the referenced resources.

It is not in scope for the Integration Dependency to describe scenarios that external consumers have with the own exposed resources.
This would overstep the boundary of self-description.

If an integration scenario consists of two sides integration with each other, each need to describe its own part in it as an Integration Dependency.
Therefore, if an integration with multiple types of systems need to be setup, this SHOULD be separated into distinct Integration Dependencies.

An integration dependency is also not meant to describe a bigger process.
Instead it focuses on the technical necessaries to create an integration for one particular purpose.

For more details, see [Integration Dependency](../../details/articles/integration-dependency).

| Property | Type | Description |
| -------- | ---- | ----------- |
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_ordid">ordId<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_ordid" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The ORD ID is a stable, globally unique ID for ORD resources or taxonomy.<br/><br/>It MUST be a valid [ORD ID](../index.md#ord-id) of the appropriate ORD type.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9-\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9-\]+)\*):(integrationDependency):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):(alpha\|beta\|v\[0-9\]+\|)$</code><br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap.foo.bar:integrationDependency:CustomerOrder:v1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_localid">localId<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_localid" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Local ID, as known by the described system.<br/><hr/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong class="introduced-version">Introduced in Version</strong>: 1.2.1<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"bundleXYZ"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_correlationids">correlationIds<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_correlationids" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Correlation IDs can be used to create a reference to related data in other repositories (especially to the system of record).<br/><br/>MUST be a valid [Correlation ID](../index.md#correlation-id).<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\\/\]+):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\\/\]+)$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["sap.s4:communicationScenario:SAP_COM_0008"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_title">title<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_title" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Human-readable title.<br/><br/>MUST NOT exceed 255 chars.<br/>MUST NOT contain line breaks.<br/><hr/><strong>Minimum Length</strong>: `1`<br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"Integration Dependency to realize Customer Order data product"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_shortdescription">shortDescription<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_shortdescription" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Plain text short description.<br/><br/>MUST NOT exceed 255 chars.<br/>MUST NOT contain line breaks.<br/><hr/><strong>Minimum Length</strong>: `1`<br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"SAP S/4HANA Cloud, our next generation cloud ERP suite designed for in-memory computing."`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_description">description<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_description" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Full description, notated in [CommonMark](https://spec.commonmark.org/) (Markdown).<br/><hr/><strong>Minimum Length</strong>: `1`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"SAP S/4HANA Cloud, our next generation cloud ERP suite designed for\nin-memory computing, acts as a digital core, connecting your\nenterprise with people, business networks, the Internet of Things,\nBig Data, and more.\n"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_partofpackage">partOfPackage<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_partofpackage" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Defines which Package the resource is part of.<br/><br/>MUST be a valid reference to a [Package](#package) ORD ID.<br/><br/>Every resource MUST be part of one package.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(package):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):(v0\|v\[1-9\]\[0-9\]\*)$</code><br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap.xref:package:SomePackage:v1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_version">version<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_version" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The complete [SemVer](https://semver.org/) version string.<br/><br/>It MUST follow the [Semantic Versioning 2.0.0](https://semver.org/) standard.<br/>It SHOULD be changed if the ORD information or referenced resource definitions changed.<br/>It SHOULD express minor and patch changes that don't lead to incompatible changes.<br/><br/>When the `version` major version changes, the [ORD ID](#ord-id) `<majorVersion>` fragment MUST be updated to be identical.<br/>In case that a resource definition file also contains a version number (e.g. [OpenAPI `info`.`version`](https://swagger.io/specification/#info-object)), it MUST be equal with the resource `version` to avoid inconsistencies.<br/><br/>The general [Version and Lifecycle](../index.md#version-and-lifecycle) flow MUST be followed.<br/><br/>Note: A change is only relevant for a version increment, if it affects the ORD resource or ORD taxonomy directly.<br/>For example: If a resource within a `Package` changes, but the package itself did not, the package version does not need to be incremented.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(0\|\[1-9\]\d\*)\\.(0\|\[1-9\]\d\*)\\.(0\|\[1-9\]\d\*)(?:-((?:0\|\[1-9\]\d\*\|\d\*\[a-zA-Z-\]\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]\*)(?:\\.(?:0\|\[1-9\]\d\*\|\d\*\[a-zA-Z-\]\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]\*))\*))?(?:\\+(\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]+(?:\\.\[0-9a-zA-Z-\]+)\*))?$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"1.2.3"`</li><li>`"1.0.0-alpha.1"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_lastupdate">lastUpdate<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_lastupdate" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Optional, but RECOMMENDED indicator when (date-time) the last change to the resource (including its definitions) happened.<br/><br/>The date format MUST comply with [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).<br/><br/>In case that this property is available and the value of it hasn't changed since the last crawling, the resource definitions do not need to be fetched and updated.<br/><br/>Together with `systemInstanceAware`, this property SHOULD be used to optimize the metadata crawling process of the ORD aggregators.<br/><hr/><strong>JSON Schema Format</strong>: `date-time`<br/><strong class="introduced-version">Introduced in Version</strong>: 1.4.0<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"2022-12-19T15:47:04+00:00"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_visibility">visibility<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_visibility" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The visibility/exposure of the described resource.<br/>This indicates who is allowed to see (and implicitly also access) the described resource.<br/><hr/><strong>Allowed Values</strong>: <ul><li><p>`"public"`: Resources are publicly accessible to customers and 3rd parties.<br/>Usually this includes an contract on the API stability, e.g. the [SAP API Deprecation Policy](https://help.sap.com/viewer/84b35b9c39b247e3ba2a31f02beee46d/Cloud/en-US/5cbfda5a9efe4e97a3e24ddaf7ec5c16.html).</p></li><li><p>`"internal"`: Resources are accessible to other applications within the same organization.<br/>However, they are not officially exposed and communicated to customers and 3rd parties.<br/>They might not come with the same guarantees on API stability.<br/><br/>Internal resources MUST NOT be made available to consumers without checking the necessary access permissions, e.g., a public API Catalog.<br/>Internal resources MAY be published through an internal API Catalog if the access permissions are ensured by it.</p></li><li><p>`"private"`: Resources that are exclusively used within an application or service.<br/>This includes resources that may be called from outside but serve purely private purposes and are not supposed to be known by other outside parties.<br/>E.g., webhooks for provisioning callbacks or backing services.<br/><br/>Private resources MUST NOT be made available to public consumers or consumers outside of the "private" scope or without the necessary access permissions.</p></li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_releasestatus">releaseStatus<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_releasestatus" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The `releaseStatus` specifies the stability of the resource and its external contract.<br/><hr/><strong>Allowed Values</strong>: <ul><li><p>`"active"`: Resource is meant for productive use and provides a stable API contract.</p></li><li><p>`"beta"`: The contract for the resource is beta and MAY not be meant for productive use.<br/><br/>In the SAP context, `beta` APIs may be changed or deleted at SAPs discretion.</p></li><li><p>`"deprecated"`: Resource has been deprecated and is destined to be decommissioned (removed) in the future.<br/><br/>Once the resource is decommissioned:<br/> * It MUST be removed from ORD.<br/> * Its removal MUST be explicitly indicated through a `Tombstone`.<br/> * If successor resources exists, they MUST be referenced through `successors`.<br/><br/>In cases where an `active` version of the API exists, it is advisable to migrate to the `active` version,<br/>however, an `active` version may not exist in all cases.</p></li></ul><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"active"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_sunsetdate">sunsetDate<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_sunsetdate" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The sunset date defines when the resource is scheduled to be decommissioned/removed.<br/><br/>If the `releaseStatus` is set to `deprecated`, the `sunsetDate` MUST be provided.<br/><br/>The date format MUST comply with [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).<br/><hr/><strong>JSON Schema Format</strong>: `date-time`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"2022-01-08T15:47:04+00:00"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_successors">successors<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_successors" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The successor resource(s).<br/><br/>MUST be a valid reference to an [API Resource](#api-resource) ORD ID.<br/><br/>If the `releaseStatus` is set to `deprecated`, `successors` MUST be provided if one exists.<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(integrationDependency):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):(v0\|v\[1-9\]\[0-9\]\*)$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["sap.foo.bar:integrationDependency:CustomerOrder:v2"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_mandatory">mandatory<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_mandatory" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">boolean</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">If true, the Integration Dependency is mandatory for the described system to function.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_aspects">aspects<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_aspects" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;[Aspect](#aspect)&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">List of integration aspects that make up the Integration Dependency.<br/><br/>Each aspect listed is a dedicated, constituent part (AND condition).<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_relatedintegrationdependencies">relatedIntegrationDependencies<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_relatedintegrationdependencies" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">If an Integration Dependency conceptually belongs or related to another Integration Dependency, this can be indicated here.<br/>One situation would be where two systems each have an Integration Dependency to describe a two-sided integration from each side.<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9-\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9-\]+)\*):(integrationDependency):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):(alpha\|beta\|v\[0-9\]+\|)$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["sap.foo.bar:integrationDependency:SomethingRelated:v1"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_links">links<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_links" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;[Link](#link)&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Generic Links with arbitrary meaning and content.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_tags">tags<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_tags" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">List of free text style tags.<br/>No special characters are allowed except `-`, `_`, `.`, `/` and ` `.<br/><br/>Tags that are assigned to a `Package` are inherited to all of the ORD resources it contains.<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^\[a-zA-Z0-9-\_.\\/ \]\*$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["storage","high-availability"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_labels">labels<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_labels" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">[Labels](#labels)</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Generic labels that can be applied to most ORD information.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="integration-dependency_documentationlabels">documentationLabels<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#integration-dependency_documentationlabels" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">[Documentation Labels](#documentation-labels)</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Generic documentation labels that can be applied to most ORD information.<br/></div>|

### Vendor

The vendor of a product or a package, usually a corporation or a customer / user.

The vendor of a `Package` is the owner or creator of the content of the package.
The vendor of a `Product` is the owner of the product.

If the resources are created by the customer / user of the described system, `customer:vendor:Customer:` MUST be used as vendor.

Both have already a [vendor namespace](../index.md#vendor-namespace) within their ORD ID.
The `Vendor` entity is giving more details on the vendor namespace.
For one vendor namespace there MUST only be exactly one `Vendor` ORD entity describing it.

For example: The only correct value for a SAP vendor reference is `sap:vendor:SAP:`.

| Property | Type | Description |
| -------- | ---- | ----------- |
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="vendor_ordid">ordId<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#vendor_ordid" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The ORD ID is a stable, globally unique ID for ORD resources or taxonomy.<br/><br/>It MUST be a valid [ORD ID](../index.md#ord-id) of the appropriate ORD type.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+):(vendor):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):()$</code><br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap:vendor:SAP:"`</li><li>`"customer:vendor:Customer:"`</li><li>`"microsoft:vendor:Microsoft:"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="vendor_title">title<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#vendor_title" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Human-readable title.<br/><br/>MUST NOT exceed 255 chars.<br/>MUST NOT contain line breaks.<br/><hr/><strong>Minimum Length</strong>: `1`<br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"SAP"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="vendor_partners">partners<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#vendor_partners" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Optional list of partner vendors, referenced through their ORD ID.<br/><br/>MUST be a valid reference to a [Vendor](#vendor) ORD ID.<br/><br/>This property can be used to indicate partnership relations between vendors.<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(vendor):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):()$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["microsoft:vendor:Microsoft:"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="vendor_tags">tags<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#vendor_tags" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">List of free text style tags.<br/>No special characters are allowed except `-`, `_`, `.`, `/` and ` `.<br/><br/>Tags that are assigned to a `Package` are inherited to all of the ORD resources it contains.<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^\[a-zA-Z0-9-\_.\\/ \]\*$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["storage","high-availability"]`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="vendor_labels">labels<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#vendor_labels" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">[Labels](#labels)</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Generic labels that can be applied to most ORD information.<br/></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="vendor_documentationlabels">documentationLabels<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#vendor_documentationlabels" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">[Documentation Labels](#documentation-labels)</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Generic documentation labels that can be applied to most ORD information.<br/></div>|

### Product

A **product** in ORD is understood as a software product:
A non-versioned, high-level entity for structuring the software portfolio from a software logistics perspective.
While **system type** is a technical concept, **product** is the term to use for internal or customer-facing communication.

Please note that the ORD concept of a product is very simple on purpose.
There are no product versions, product variants, and other more detailed concepts.
ORD assumes that this is handled by specialized systems and that ORD only provides the means to correlate to them.

| Property | Type | Description |
| -------- | ---- | ----------- |
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="product_ordid">ordId<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#product_ordid" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">The ORD ID is a stable, globally unique ID for ORD resources or taxonomy.<br/><br/>It MUST be a valid [ORD ID](../index.md#ord-id) of the appropriate ORD type.<br/><hr/><strong>Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(product):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\]+):()$</code><br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"sap:product:S4HANA_OD:"`</li></ul></div>|
|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="product_correlationids">correlationIds<br/><span class="optional">OPTIONAL</span><a class="hash-link" href="#product_correlationids" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">Array&lt;string&gt;</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Correlation IDs can be used to create a reference to related data in other repositories (especially to the system of record).<br/><br/>MUST be a valid [Correlation ID](../index.md#correlation-id).<br/><hr/><strong>Array Item Regex Pattern</strong>: <code class="regex">^(\[a-z0-9\]+(?:\[.\]\[a-z0-9\]+)\*):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\\/\]+):(\[a-zA-Z0-9.\_\\-\\/\]+)$</code><br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`["sap.xref:product:ABC"]`</li></ul></div>|

|<div class="interface-property-name anchor" id="product_shortdescription">shortDescription<br/><span class="mandatory">MANDATORY</span><a class="hash-link" href="#product_shortdescription" title="Direct link to property"></a></div>|<div class="interface-property-type">string</div>|<div class="interface-property-description">Plain text short description.<br/><br/>MUST NOT exceed 255 chars.<br/>MUST NOT contain line breaks.<br/><hr/><strong>Minimum Length</strong>: `1`<br/><strong>Maximum Length</strong>: `255`<br/><strong>Example Values</strong>: <ul class="examples"><li>`"The next generation digital core designed to help you run simple in a digital economy."`</li></ul></div>|
